verses.verse: Keep <S%H8104><s%> your foot <S%H7272><s%> when you go <S%H3212><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>, and be more ready <S%H7138><s%> to hear <S%H8085><s%>, than to give <S%H5414><s%> the sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%>: for they consider <S%H3045><s%> not that they do <S%H6213><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>.

Be not rash <S%H926><s%> with your mouth <S%H6310><s%>, and let not your heart <S%H3820><s%> be hasty <S%H4116><s%> to utter <S%H3318><s%> any thing <S%H1697><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> God <S%H430><s%>: for God <S%H430><s%> is in heaven <S%H8064><s%>, and you upon earth <S%H776><s%>: therefore let your words <S%H1697><s%> be few <S%H4592><s%>.

For a dream <S%H2472><s%> comes <S%H935><s%> through the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of business <S%H6045><s%>; and a fool <S%H3684><s%>'s voice <S%H6963><s%> is known by multitude <S%H7230><s%> of words <S%H1697><s%>.

When you vow <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%>, defer <S%H309><s%> not to pay <S%H7999><s%> it <S%H2656><s%>; for he has no pleasure in fools <S%H3684><s%>: pay <S%H7999><s%> that which you have vowed <S%H5087><s%>.
Better <S%H2896><s%> is it that you should not vow <S%H5087><s%>, than that you should vow <S%H5087><s%> and not pay <S%H7999><s%>.

Allow <S%H5414><s%> not your mouth <S%H6310><s%> to cause your flesh <S%H1320><s%> to sin <S%H2398><s%>; neither say <S%H559><s%> you before <S%H6440><s%> the angel <S%H4397><s%>, that it was a error <S%H7684><s%>: therefore should God <S%H430><s%> be angry <S%H7107><s%> at your voice <S%H6963><s%>, and destroy <S%H2254><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of your hands <S%H3027><s%>?
For in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of dreams <S%H2472><s%> and many <S%H7235><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> there are also various vanities <S%H1892><s%>: but fear <S%H3372><s%> you God <S%H430><s%>.

If you see <S%H7200><s%> the oppression <S%H6233><s%> of the poor <S%H7326><s%>, and violent <S%H1499><s%> perverting of judgment <S%H4941><s%> and justice <S%H6664><s%> in a province <S%H4082><s%>, marvel <S%H8539><s%> not at the matter <S%H2656><s%>: for he that is higher <S%H1364><s%> than the highest <S%H1364><s%> watches <S%H8104><s%>; and there be higher <S%H1364><s%> than they <S%H5921><s%>.
Moreover the profit <S%H3504><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> is for all <S%H4428><s%>: the king himself is served <S%H5647><s%> by the field <S%H7704><s%>.

He that loves <S%H157><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> shall not be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with silver <S%H3701><s%>; nor he that loves <S%H157><s%> abundance <S%H1995><s%> with increase <S%H8393><s%>: this is also vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

When goods <S%H2896><s%> increase <S%H7235><s%>, they are increased <S%H7231><s%> that eat <S%H398><s%> them <S%H3788><s%>: and what good is there to the owners <S%H1167><s%> there <S%H518><s%>, except the beholding <S%H7207><s%> of them with their eyes <S%H5869><s%>?

The sleep <S%H8142><s%> of a laboring man <S%H5647><s%> is sweet <S%H4966><s%>, whether he eat <S%H398><s%> little <S%H4592><s%> or much <S%H7235><s%>: but the abundance <S%H7647><s%> of the rich <S%H6223><s%> will not allow <S%H3240><s%> him to sleep <S%H3462><s%>.

There is <S%H3426><s%> a severe <S%H2470><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> which I have seen <S%H7200><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, namely <S%H6239><s%>, riches kept <S%H8104><s%> for the owners <S%H1167><s%> to their hurt <S%H7451><s%>.

But those riches <S%H6239><s%> perish <S%H6><s%> by evil <S%H7451><s%> hardship <S%H6045><s%>: and he fathers <S%H3205><s%> a son <S%H1121><s%>, and there is nothing <S%H3972><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%>.

As he came forth <S%H3318><s%> of his mother <S%H517><s%>'s womb <S%H990><s%>, naked <S%H6174><s%> shall he return <S%H7725><s%> to go <S%H3212><s%> as he came <S%H935><s%>, and shall take <S%H5375><s%> nothing <S%H3972><s%> of his labor <S%H5999><s%>, which he may carry away <S%H3212><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%>.

And this <S%H2090><s%> also is a severe <S%H2470><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>, that in all points <S%H5980><s%> as he came <S%H935><s%>, so shall he go <S%H3212><s%>: and what profit <S%H3504><s%> has he that has labored <S%H5998><s%> for the wind <S%H7307><s%>?
All his days <S%H3117><s%> also he eat <S%H398><s%> in darkness <S%H2822><s%>, and he has much <S%H7235><s%> sorrow <S%H3707><s%> and wrath <S%H7110><s%> with his sickness <S%H2483><s%>.

Behold that which I have seen <S%H7200><s%>: it is good <S%H2896><s%> and fitting <S%H3303><s%> for one to eat <S%H398><s%> and to drink <S%H8354><s%>, and to enjoy <S%H7200><s%> the good <S%H2896><s%> of all his labor <S%H5999><s%> that he takes <S%H5998><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%> all <S%H4557><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life <S%H2416><s%>, which God <S%H430><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> him <S%H2506><s%>: for it is his portion.

Every man <S%H120><s%> also to whom God <S%H430><s%> has given <S%H5414><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%> and wealth <S%H5233><s%>, and has given him power <S%H7980><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> there <S%H5375><s%>, and to take his portion <S%H2506><s%>, and to rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in his labor <S%H5999><s%>; this <S%H2090><s%> is the gift <S%H4991><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>.

For he shall not much <S%H7235><s%> remember <S%H2142><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life <S%H2416><s%>; because God <S%H430><s%> answers <S%H6031><s%> him in the joy <S%H8057><s%> of his heart <S%H3820><s%>.
